business.headline: Adani Total Gas and Jio-bp partner to expand fuel access across IndiaThis collaboration will see Jio-bp's premium petrol and diesel sold at select Adani fuel outlets, according to ATGL's statement.
Sensex closes 700 points higher, Nifty above 25,200, Titan up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 700.40 points to end at 82,755.51, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 200.40 points to close at 25,244.75.

Jewellery vs gold ETFs: How to make make money shine, not just wrists, explains CAGold jewellery may look beautiful, but it often comes with hidden costs, resale hassles, and emotional attachment that cloud financial judgement.

Planning to buy a house? This is India's most affordable city in 2025A report from Knight Frank India's latest Affordability Index highlights that RBI's decision to cut the repo rate by 100 basis points since February 2025 has played a key role in improving housing affordability across the country.

Want SIP success? Do this every month, says stock market expertSIP calculators do a fine job of showing projections. However, they don't account for emotions, self-doubt, or the unpredictability of life, mentioned a stock market expert.
GST Council meeting: What to expect from upcoming meet?The previous GST Council meeting took place on December 21, 2024, in Jaisalmer. Since then, many matters have remained pending.

8 key documents you must keep ready before filing your ITR for FY 2024–25One of the first documents you'll need is Form 16, which your employer gives you. It shows your total salary, how much tax was deducted, and what deductions were claimed.

EPFO raises auto-settlement limit to Rs 5 lakh for faster fund accessIn the fiscal year 2024-25, the EPFO processed a record 2.34 crore advance claims through the auto-settlement process, marking a 161% increase compared to the previous year.
Sensex jumps 700 points: Why is the stock market rising today? The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 722.55 points to 82,777.66, while the NSE Nifty50 added 209.15 points to 25,253.50 as of 2:25 pm.

HDB Financial opens today: Should you subscribe to the biggest IPO of 2025?HDB Financial IPO: The public listing consists of a fresh issue of 3.38 crore shares worth Rs 2,500 crore, and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of 13.51 crore shares, totalling Rs 10,000 crore.
Sensex, Nifty rally continues for second day as geopolitical fears subsideThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 442.13 points to 82,497.24, while the NSE Nifty50 added 127.10 points to 25,171.45 as of 9:32 am.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty to open higher? Check key trading levelsA fragile ceasefire between Iran and Israel has helped calm investor nerves and improve market sentiment across Asia and other major regions.

entertainment.headline: Fitness influencer 'Liver King' arrested after threatening Joe Rogan onlineFitness influencer Liver King Brian Johnson was arrested in Austin for threatening Joe Rogan on social media.

Perfect Match season 3: Netflix announces cast and release schedulePerfect Match Season 3 premieres August 1 on Netflix, featuring stars from The Bachelor, Love Island, and more in a high-stakes dating showdown.

Film body slams Diljit Dosanjh's casting in Border 2 amid Sardaar Ji 3 rowThe Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) has condemned Diljit Dosanjh's casting in 'Border 2'. This move highlights ongoing tensions over collaborations with Pakistani artistes and national sentiment.

Pak actor was signed before Pahalgam attack: Sardaarji 3 makers on Hania Amir rowAmid a raging controversy, the makers of 'Sardaarji 3', on Wednesday, clarified that Pakistani actor Hania Amir was signed before the Pahalgam attack. The film is headlined by actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh.

Panchayat writer Chandan Kumar says direction for Season 5 is almost done'Panchayat' writer Chandan Kumar says the direction for Season 5 is almost done. The fourth season of the TVF series premiered on Prime Video on June 24.

After Srikanth's arrest, Tamil actor Krishna questioned by police in drug caseTamil actor Krishna was questioned by the police in connection with the ongoing drug abuse investigation. Earlier, actor Srikanth was arrested under four sections of the Narcotics Control Act.

Son of Sardaar 2: Ajay Devgn unveils new poster with star-studded castAjay Devgn unveiled the poster of 'Son of Sardaar 2', titled 'The Return of the Sardaar'. The film will be released in theatres on July 25, 2025.

Aayush Sharma undergoes two surgeries, says good health isn't just about six-packsActor Aayush Sharma recently underwent two back surgeries following an injury sustained while performing a stunt in 'Ruslaan'. He shared an emotional post about learning to prioritise health and returning stronger for his family and fans.

Aamir Khan's Coolie cameo features intense 15-minute face-off: ReportRajinikanth's 'Coolie' will feature a high-octane 15-minute climax with Aamir Khan in a powerful cameo role. The action-packed face-off between the two stars is set to be one of the film's biggest highlights.

Taylor Swift stuns with surprise Shake It Off performance at Travis Kelce's concertTaylor Swift lit up Travis Kelce's Tight End University concert in Nashville with a surprise performance of 'Shake It Off'. The unexpected moment thrilled fans and NFL stars attending the multi-day event.

Choo Young-woo and Cho Yi-hyun on Head Over Heels, love for Indian fans'Head Over Heels' is a captivating K-drama, starring Choo Young-woo and Cho Yi-hyun, who share their thoughts on fate and love in an exclusive interview. The actors express their admiration for their roles and convey heartfelt messages to their growing audience in India.

R Madhavan jokes about looking young on screen: Don't have the budget for de-agingActor R Madhavan opened up about his secret of looking youthful in an interaction with the media on Wednesday. The actor said people have been accusing him of de-aging.

Chikitu: Rajinikanth's brief appearance in Coolie music video steals the showA new song from superstar Rajinikanth's much-anticipated film 'Coolie' was released on Wednesday. Titled 'Chikitu', the track features T Rajendar, Anirudh Ravichander, Sandy, and Arivu, with a brief appearance by Rajinikanth.

Actor Joe Marinelli, known for General Hospital, dies of stomach cancer at 68Popular soap actor Joe Marinelli, best known for 'General Hospital' and 'Santa Barbara', has died at 68. He was diagnosed with throat and stomach cancer a few years ago.

K-drama actor Choi Yoon-ra announces pregnancy, flaunts baby bump in new picsKorean actor Choi Yoon-ra recently shared heartwarming pregnancy pictures on social media. She also revealed that she is expecting a baby girl.

Lakshmi Manchu says art and politics should be kept separate amid Sardaar Ji 3 rowActor Lakshmi Manchu recently shared her views on the ban on Pakistani actors. She stated that art and politics should not be mixed.

The Traitors makers announce Season 2 of Karan Johar's reality show'The Traitors' will make a comeback with fresh faces and a brand-new season. The makers of the show announced Season 2 on Instagram on Wednesday.

Mahesh Babu praises Sumanth's Anaganaga, calls it worth your timeAmid his packed schedule, actor Mahesh Babu took a moment to praise Sumanth's Telugu OTT release 'Anaganaga', calling it a 'beautifully told' and 'emotionally resonant' story. His continued support for heartfelt, content-driven cinema has once again struck a chord with fans.

Tough times don't last: Kareena sends strength to sister Karisma on birthdayActor Kareena Kapoor Khan extended birthday wishes to her sister Karisma Kapoor on Wednesday. Kareena shared a throwback photo and wrote an inspiring caption, sending love and strength her sister's way.

general news.headline: Stopped nuclear war: Trump repeats India-Pak truce claim, Congress says '18th time'The US President's latest claim came despite Prime Minister Narendra Modi clarifying days ago that America had no role in reaching a truce between India and Pakistan after three days of military conflict following the Pahalgam terror attack.

Shashi Tharoor posts cryptic message minutes after Congress chief's tauntCongress MP Shashi Tharoor shared a cryptic message amid differences with the Congress, minutes after Mallikarjun Kharge took a swipe at him for his repeated praise for Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Zelenskyy switches to formals at Nato summit months after Oval Office fiascoUkrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy opted for a rugged black suit-style jacket and shirt at the Nato summit. This came months after he was slammed by a reporter for not wearing a suit during his February meeting with Donald Trump at the Oval Office.

Shubhanshu Shukla launched into orbit, Space Station docking nextAs the Falcon-9 delivered the Crew Dragon into space, the four astronauts will now work towards catching the Space Station which is flying above them.
Who won the 12-day Israel-Iran war?Netanyahu, Khamenei and Donald Trump battle for top honours

Iran admits US strikes badly damaged N-sites days after saying no contaminationIran admitted its nuclear sites were "badly damaged" following the US's strikes on them and demanded Washington pay compensation or else it would file a complaint with the UN.

Multiple flash floods triggered by cloudbursts in Himachal Pradesh, 2 deadEmergency responders, district administration officials, and police personnel reached the spot and took stock of the situation on the ground.

'Silver dinner plates, Rs 5,000 per meal': Maharashtra government event sparks rowAn event hosted by the Maharashtra government has come under the scanner after guests were served meals on silver plates, despite the state facing strain. However, sources refuted claims of the government hosting a "lavish" party.

Prada ignored India. Louis Vuitton put it center stage at Paris Fashion Week French luxury brand LV's creative director and rapper Pharrell Williams put on a show that openly celebrated India, a move that LV's contemporaries (hello, Prada) should certainly take cues from.
Meril Launches MyClip, India's First Transcatheter-Edge-to-Edge Repair (TEER) SystemThe launch of MyClip TEER System marks a transformative moment for structural heart therapy in India.

Daddy has to use strong language: Nato chief's banter with Trump over F-bombDonald Trump dropped the F-bomb on live TV while expressing frustration as Israel and Iran exchanged missiles despite a ceasefire being declared.

How Indira gave BJP a lethal weapon even before it was bornFifty years after Indira Gandhi imposed the national Emergency, the BJP continues to use it as proof of Congress's authoritarian past and its own legacy of resistance. From blunting attacks on its intentions to claiming a broader legacy and role, the Emergency remains the BJP's ultimate weapon of choice against the Congress.

Video: Ahmedabad woman dies after truck driver hits scooter, drags her for 20 feetA truck driver was arrested after he hit a woman riding a scooter and dragged her for about 20 feet on a busy road in Ahmedabad.

I was panicking: Rohit on how Virat calmed dressing room in T20 World Cup finalRohit Sharma reflected on the dramatic turn of events in the T20 World Cup 2024 final, heaping praise on the match-winning knocks of Virat Kohli and Axar Patel. He described the triumph in Barbados as the greatest moment of his career.

Grateful to freedom-loving people: Iran thanks India for support during warThe Iranian Embassy in New Delhi thanked the political leadership, common citizens, and activists among others, who, it said, stood firmly and vocally with Tehran during the "12-day war", as US President Donald Trump called it.

Akali Dal's Bikram Majithia laundered over Rs 540 crore drug money, says SITMajithia and his wife claimed that members of the Vigilance Bureau barged into their house in Green Avenue in Amritsar. They claimed that a similar raid was conducted at their residence in Chandigarh.

Noida HR's post on candidate resigning on day 1 sparks debate on work cultureAlthough the HR professional acknowledged that the job was challenging, she said that all details had been clearly discussed before the offer was made.

US bombing of Iran's N-sites like Hiroshima, ended war with Israel: TrumpTrump's comments followed reports revealing that the US Defense Intelligence Agency had assessed that the strikes had set back Iran's nuclear program by just a few months, despite him and administration officials saying it had been obliterated.

How was the Constitution revived again after EmergencyFormer PM Indira Gandhi, who imposed an Emergency that suspended civil liberties, crushed dissent, and jailed lakhs of critics, was enabled by exploiting constitutional provisions like Articles 352, 356, and 359. Backed by controversial court rulings and draconian laws like MISA, Indian laws and constitutional provisions became the very tool Indira used to silence democracy 50 years ago.

Iran's nuclear programme isn't dead, but can it recover?In the last 12 days, Israel has repeatedly targeted Natanz, Isfahan, and Arak, causing extensive damage to key nuclear sites and putting them out of service for a long time, if not permanently.

Pak actor was signed before Pahalgam attack: Sardaarji 3 makers on Hania Amir rowAmid a raging controversy, the makers of 'Sardaarji 3', on Wednesday, clarified that Pakistani actor Hania Amir was signed before the Pahalgam attack. The film is headlined by actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh.

Mark Zuckerberg betting big on AI talent, offering Rs 860 crore salaryAccording to a report from WSJ, Mark Zuckerberg has been directly messaging top researchers, developers, and entrepreneurs across the world, offering them huge salary packages of up to $100 million, which is about Rs 860 crore when converted to Indian currency.

Delhi woman, 19, pushed off roof by burqa-clad man over marriage dispute, diesA woman, 19, was killed after she was pushed off the roof of her house by a burqa-clad man after an argument between them in Delhi. The victim, who was in a relationship with the accused, was upset that he was marrying someone else, police sources said.

Mangaluru man attends IIT-Bombay classes without valid admission, arrestedA man from Mangaluru was arrested by the Mumbai police for trespassing and attending classes at IIT-Bombay without getting admission. He had reportedly come to the campus to attend a one-day event.

sports.headline: Rishabh Pant is reinventing batsmanship, reminds of Gilchrist: Greg ChappellFormer Australia cricketer Greg Chappell has showered praise on India's wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant, saying that he's reinventing the game.

Rishabh Pant was the only one who contacted me during tough times: Prithvi ShawIndia and Mumbai batter Prithvi Shaw revealed that he only received support from Rishabh Pant during the tough phase of his career. Shaw has been going through tumultuous times in his professional life as he found no bidders during the IPL 2025 auction.

IPL: Rajasthan Royals owner accuses former co-owner of blackmail in UK courtLondon-based venture capitalist Manoj Badale and his company Emerging Media Ventures are suing businessman Raj Kundra at London's High Court for allegedly breaching a 2019 confidential settlement agreement.

Sam Konstas fails on return as Shamar Joseph decimates top orderWI vs AUS, 1st Test: Australia's returning opener Sam Konstas and new No. 3 Cameron Green failed in the first hour on Day 1. Pacers Shamar Joseph and Jayden Seales made the most of helpful conditions on Wednesday morning in Barbados.

Sri Lanka dominate proceedings as Bangladesh collapse on Day 1 in ColomboSri Lanka had a dominating Day 1 of the second Test against Bangladesh in Colombo as they left them reeling at 220/8 at the stumps. Asitha Fernando (2/43), Vishwa Fernando (2/35) and Sonal Dinusha (2/22) emerged as top performers from the day.

Harshit Rana released from Test squad, day after Gambhir's clarification: ReportFast bowler Harshit Rana has been released from India's Test squad before the second Test in Birmingham. He did not travel with the rest of the team, which left for Birmingham from Leeds on Wednesday, June 25.

How Ravi Shastri's booming voice made Rohit forget toss coin, batter revealsIndia ODI captain Rohit Sharma recently revealed how Ravi Shastri made him forget the coin toss during the blockbuster clash against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2024.

I was panicking: Rohit on how Virat calmed dressing room in T20 World Cup finalRohit Sharma reflected on the dramatic turn of events in the T20 World Cup 2024 final, heaping praise on the match-winning knocks of Virat Kohli and Axar Patel. He described the triumph in Barbados as the greatest moment of his career.

Shardul Thakur in Leeds Test: Misfiring or mismanaged? Numbers say it allIndia all-rounder Shardul Thakur was underutilised by captain Shubman Gill in the first innings despite Prasidh Krishna and Mohammed Siraj leaking runs consistently. The India captain did realise his mistake and made the India seamer deliver ten overs in the second innings, where he helped scalp two wickets.

Shubman Gill has everything to be a successful captain: Gautam GambhirGautam Gambhir feels that Shubman Gill has all the skills to be a successful captain for India, but said that the 25-year-old needs to be given the time to excel. Gill's first outing as captain ended in a loss for India at Headingley.

How Ravi Shastri's booming voice made Rohit forget toss coin, batter revealsIndia ODI captain Rohit Sharma recently revealed how Ravi Shastri made him forget the coin toss during the blockbuster clash against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2024.

I was panicking: Rohit on how Virat calmed dressing room in T20 World Cup finalRohit Sharma reflected on the dramatic turn of events in the T20 World Cup 2024 final, heaping praise on the match-winning knocks of Virat Kohli and Axar Patel. He described the triumph in Barbados as the greatest moment of his career.

Shardul Thakur in Leeds Test: Misfiring or mismanaged? Numbers say it allIndia all-rounder Shardul Thakur was underutilised by captain Shubman Gill in the first innings despite Prasidh Krishna and Mohammed Siraj leaking runs consistently. The India captain did realise his mistake and made the India seamer deliver ten overs in the second innings, where he helped scalp two wickets.

Shubman Gill has everything to be a successful captain: Gautam GambhirGautam Gambhir feels that Shubman Gill has all the skills to be a successful captain for India, but said that the 25-year-old needs to be given the time to excel. Gill's first outing as captain ended in a loss for India at Headingley.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
